front.title: Credentials Provisioning and Management via EAP (EAP-CPROM)

abstract.t: With the increase number of devices, protocols, and applications that rely on strong credentials (e.g., digital certificates, keys, or tokens) for network access, the need for a standard credentials provisioning layer is paramount. In particular, since EAP is deployed for authentication needs, the authors extend this use-case by including support for provisioning and management of credentials. In particular, this specification defines how to support the provisioning of strong credentials to users and/or devices without the need for providing IP connectivity. The use of EAP not only for provisiong but also for managing network credentials provides a general conduit that can be exploited in different environments (e.g., Wired and WiFi networks credentials management).
